question:
Which graduation announcement is more formal?

Options:
A. Fred Levin is graduating, and we couldn't be more proud!
B. We are proud to announce the graduation of Fred Levin.
answer_text: The second graduation announcement is more formal. It uses more ceremonious language (proud to announce). The other graduation announcement uses more conversational language (we couldn't be more proud!).
choices: Fred Levin is graduating, and we couldn't be more proud!
We are proud to announce the graduation of Fred Levin.

question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
The Murray family is going to spend two weeks in Ocean City, but for Kyle it will be a working vacation, since he'll be checking in with the office every day.

Options:
A. euphemism
B. oxymoron
answer_text:
The text uses an oxymoron, a joining of two seemingly contradictory terms.
Working vacation is a contradiction, because going on a vacation implies that you are taking a break from work.

question:
Think about the magnetic force between the magnets in each pair. Which of the following statements is true?

Options:
A. The strength of the magnetic force is the same in both pairs.
B. The magnetic force is weaker in Pair 2.
C. The magnetic force is weaker in Pair 1.
answer_text:
Distance affects the strength of the magnetic force. But the distance between the magnets in Pair 1 and in Pair 2 is the same.
So, the strength of the magnetic force is the same in both pairs.
choices: The strength of the magnetic force is the same in both pairs.
The magnetic force is weaker in Pair 2.
The magnetic force is weaker in Pair 1.

question:
Which tense does the sentence use?
Samuel opens the big box.

Options:
A. future tense
B. present tense
C. past tense
answer_text: The sentence is in present tense. You can tell because it uses a present-tense verb, opens. The verb ends in -s and tells you about something that is true or happening now.

question:
Which object has the least thermal energy?

Options:
A. a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 28°C
B. a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 22°C
C. a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 41°C
answer_text: All three bowls of oatmeal have the same mass but different temperatures. Since the 22°C bowl of oatmeal is the coldest, it has the least thermal energy.
choices: a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 28°C
a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 22°C
a bowl of oatmeal at a temperature of 41°C

question:
Which of these cities is marked on the map?

Options:
A. Pittsburgh
B. New York City
C. Washington, D.C.
D. Boston
answer_text: The city is Boston, Massachusetts. Washington, D.C., New York City, and Pittsburgh are marked with gray circles on the map below.

question:
Which animal's feet are also adapted for digging?

Options:
A. prairie dog
B. bottlenose dolphin
answer_text:
Look at the picture of the Alpine marmot.
The Alpine marmot has long, straight claws. Its feet are adapted for digging. The Alpine marmot uses its claws to break up soil and move it out of the way.
Now look at each animal. Figure out which animal has a similar adaptation.
The prairie dog has long, straight claws. Its feet are adapted for digging.
The bottlenose dolphin has flippers for feet. Its feet are not adapted for digging. The bottlenose dolphin uses its flippers to swim.

question:
Which continent is highlighted?

Options:
A. Antarctica
B. Africa
C. Europe

Which is scratchier?

Options:
A. wood bat
B. burlap sack
answer_text:
Scratchy is a property. A scratchy material is rough and itchy against your skin.
Look at each picture, one at a time. Imagine touching the material shown in each picture.
Of the choices, the burlap sack is scratchier. If you touch burlap, it will feel rough and itchy.

question:
What information supports the conclusion that Damon inherited this trait?

Options:
A. Damon likes to wear a blue sweater to match his blue eyes.
B. Damon's mother has blue eyes. She passed this trait down to Damon.
choices: Damon likes to wear a blue sweater to match his blue eyes.
Damon's mother has blue eyes. She passed this trait down to Damon.
